DOC.brief_summary: The beneficial effects of rhythmical auditory stimulation (RAS) on spatio-temporal gait characteristics in Parkinson's disease (PD) are attested by clinical research. Nonetheless, it is still unclear which auditory information parameters (i.e. complexity, temporal regularity or adaptability to gait) maximize the effectiveness of RAS. Objectives: To evaluate the beneficial effects of RAS on spatio-temporal gait characteristics in PD patients with gait disorders according to: - RAS complexity (i.e. metronome, amplitude modulated noise, music) - RAS variability (i.e fixed, random, semi-random) - RAS adapted in real-time to gait Variability study: To study the impact of RAS variability (i.e fixed, random, semi-random) in 20 PD patients and 20 healthy controls on spatio-temporal gait characteristics with metronome, amplitude noise and music. Adaptability studyTo study the impact of RAS adaptability (i.e fixed, random, adapted in real-time to gait) in 20 PD patients and 20 healthy controls on spatio-temporal gait characteristics with metronome, amplitude noise and music.
DOC.brief_title: Rhythmic Auditory Stimulation Optimalization for Gait Improvement in Parkinson's Disease - BeatPark Study
